comment: StoryGlory Prof Bobbie shaking from phony balogni Shake & Bake earthquake stop just be awake when he confabulates You'll be surprised what you learn he's Ricky Bobby nerding out faster can't stop this man zooming fuming with knowledge want a challenge stop being so low get up stay up when you hear Prof Bobbie speak story his glory shame no be game

Has only 4 tests and 2 HW's. Test are set at during very specific hours during the day, so make sure you have no work that day.. You are only alloted that time frame and can't start just before for the full amount of time. I got off a shift and only had 10 minutes to take a test and told the prof and he refused to reopen it.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy

comment: This professor is evil, avoid at all cost! 80% weight test 20% insanely long project. Refused to see me during OPEN office hours. Test are incredibly difficult with more than half the class failing any given exam on average. Test questions are incredibly nuanced and often do not reflect understanding of larger concept, but insanely niche edge cases
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: He lectures are good. Don't expect to get an A in his class. Most students got C's and B's. Four multiple choice tests and two homework. I took him in-person and never had a problem getting my questions answered. He really does care about his students and making sure they learn something. Take him if you want to learn, not if you want an easy time.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Caring--Test heavy

comment: The class structure is incredibly test heavy so get ready to glue yourself to the textbooks. Some of the wording of test questions is confusing but the professor is really helpful if you ask for clarity. Clearly knows his stuff but this course is really unforgiving. But hey, the professor is funny sometimes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Take this professor if you want to destroy your GPA. I did not learn anything in class. If you are f2f, sometimes he will post the recordings of the lecture but don't expect to be able to understand any of it. The entire course is very exam heavy, f2f exams. I also found the questions in the exams were not relevant to the slides he posted.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy

comment: Took asynchronous and he made the tests the same time as in-person class. Terrible microphone quality and no video for online lectures. Only 6 grades (2 HWs for 20%, 4 tests for 80%). Points can be retroactively taken from first hw based on how you do on second hw. No matter how well you study, questions will surprise you. Avoid for last semester!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Horrible. The lecture videos are just in-class recordings and the audio quality is horrible and not understandable. The homework is okay, but the tests do not seem to reflect anything in the course. I am unsure how to study for this class. Also the only person teaching this course this semester. He's keeping people from graduating. Horrible.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Only six assignments, two homework assignments and four tests. Assignments were fairly easy, Tests were incredibly difficult. Lectures were difficult to follow.

I am currently taking this course and am on spring break. However he made an assignment due during spring break after poorly organizing the rest of his class. His assignments come with 2 different sets of instructions and his tests for a supposedly "asynchronous" course have 75 minute windows. He is unaccesible through email and very moody. AVOID

So he's the only one that teaches this class for CS requirement so it's almost meaningless to say stay away from this class.
Took the first test, the median was a D.

There was no easing into the test in form of study guide, homework, or anything that could hint at what might be on the test other than test chapters.

He's terrible with tech.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This class is extremely difficult and time consuming. Personally I spent 3 days no shower, no food, and glued to my laptop studying for the final just to get a 77. Failed the first test after putting in several study hours. The tests are tricky and the project takes forever to complete. It also seems that this class has so much outdated information
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Project is nothing related to what covered in the lecture and course contents. Never reply to email. Horrible experience with this professor.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Test heavy

comment: Legit, just don't take this professor, he's somehow the worst when it comes to technology which is ironic considering he teaches a 4000-level CS course. He's unfamiliar with the term 'asynchronous' and will create exams that are only open for 75 minutes. And his video lectures sound like they were recorded with a 3DS. Please avoid this professor .
rating_tags: Group projects

comment: Absolutely do not take this professor. The asychronous exams are taken within a two hour time window which defeats the entire purpose of an asychronous class. Do not email him on outlook he will 100% not respond to you and if he does, he will be extremely passive aggressive and tell you to move to D2L. The assignments are boring and forgettable.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: The class itself is easy, but you won't learn anything, as you do not really learn anything at all. The grading policies are vague and wrong half the time, but I will not they are all basically completion grades. The TA was helpful in clearing up confusion. Also, Bobbie is unwilling to provide any accommodation no matter what; keep that in mind.

AVOID AVOID AVOID, Dr. Bobbie structures his class horribly, for being online asynchronous having a 2h window for exams is unacceptable. His assignments and homework do not have clear instructions. He takes for ever to grade, his video lectures are impossible to understand. Take somebody else.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: I recommend taking the in-person section. Bobbie is a very kind a funny professor. The class is basically a combo of 3502 and 3622 so I recc taking those first. pretty beefy project but not particularly hard. If you read the textbook you're guaranteed to get an A in the course. Tests were pretty easy, but the question wording can be a lil tricky
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: His tests reflect the textbook material very clearly. This is an upper level course. He is a very monotone lecturer, and some material is outdated (saying XML is more popular than JSON). But he's a sweet guy, knows his stuff, and if you read, know OS, org and arch and networking, you'll pass.
rating_tags: Get ready to read

comment: omg he is exactly what every other 1 star review said about him grading scale unclear for test doesn't even show what the correct answers are after he grades .
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Videos are recordings of an in-person lecture. The audio is terrible quality and I couldn't understand anything he was saying. The assignments are focused more on being IEEE style than content. This "asynchronous" online course has two hour windows for tests. I'm not sure how anyone finds it acceptable to charge people money for a course this bad.

3 exams 25% grade each plus 1 homework and 1 research paper. Up to midterm period most students did good on exam 1 and the only hw. I know this from asking students in my class their grades. Exam 2 roles around after the withdraw period and the highest grade was around 75. Most were F's. Same thing exam 3. Seems he curved the class and paper.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Do not take him online. Class says asynchronous but he gives a 2 hr test window and does not allow makeups. Also his recorded lectures are terrible quality and unpleasant to listen to.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment:
He takes class participation into account when grading tests. If you actively participate, you get better scores. 
4 tests, 1 group project, 1 term paper.
Tests get progressively less coherent in grading standards and test questions.
Group project ends up with 1 person doing everything. You grade teammates collectively for project. 
You'll pass.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Bobbie is a nice enough guy but man is this class brutal. He is very demanding of his students. Tests are all written response and he's a tough grader. If you're seriously engaged with the subject matter then I'm sure he's great. If, like me, you're not, then this class will be a slog. My advice: thoroughly read the textbook to prep for exams.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment:
Bobbie has been labeled as many things, but he's really not that bad. My advice is to TAKE HIM IN PERSON!

I can't stress that enough. For some reason he acts dismissive through emails and teams, however he's willing to answer any questions in person. Just go to his lectures and read the book and you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Accessible outside class

comment: This professor is the worst. Just do not take him.

Nice Professor, you just have to put in the amount of work required for it. Read the textbook instead of the lectures, you will get more knowledge. Try to answer the questions as simply as possible.

2 tests, 1 final, 2 homeworks. Got 100 on all without curving, it is not magic, just read the book.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: 3 tests 75% and homework/project 25% of the grade. Tests are really hard and the class average was always really bad for them, but he is more lenient when it comes to hws/project grades. he takes 100% of the test from the book. I would not take him again, because it was really stressful, but he curved the final grade by more than 10 points.
rating_tags: Tough grader--EXTRA CREDIT--Test heavy

comment: Professor Patrick Bobbie is not a great professor. he dint give even access of lecture video until students ask and he don't reply in time. Awful professor for grading be ready to learn by your self. Lots of students drop the class and his class never fill up unless and until students don't have other choice.
rating_tags: Hilarious--Online Savvy

comment: He is the worse professor I have ever seen in my life. He said the test was very easy, but I didn't believe him; he is the harsh grader ever. I never recommend taking his class, but unfortunately, he is only the instructor for CS4504 at KSU.
rating_tags: Tough grader

comment: 2nd class I've had with him. Not an easy A like other professors, not unfair like some say. Must put in effort. He curves. Lectures are mostly unhelpful: you must read the textbook and understand the material (flashcards!). Textbooks are pretty short and simple to read. In person was better than online. Online communication/organization was bad.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Test heavy

comment: The tests are difficult and the project can seem daunting. I recommend reading the textbook before lecture so you can ask any questions during class. If you stick to the end, he lets you earn points back from the project, and he grades the final exam more generously. Overall, a difficult class with a lot of work, but not impossible.

I don't think Dr. Bobbie is that bad. The tests are tough, and the project takes some effort, but I think the amount of work he expects is fair. Seems it's easier to understand how he does things if you take him in person, which I did. Smart guy, nice, not a very good lecturer though. I read the textbook during class.
rating_tags: Group projects--Test heavy

comment: Worst prof at KSU. He is a terrible communicator, and he dings you on random details. I rewatched his lectures 3+ times and made flashcards to just barely pass his exams. He will send an email the day the project is due to add new requirements. He also takes weeks to grade; we're about to take the final and still have half the grades missing.

Avoid. This professor wants his classes to fail because he is the only one that teaches parallel and distributed computing so he will make more money off returning failing students. Only 5 HEAVY graded tests/assignments. It's VERY easy to fail his class. Save your time and money AVOID this professor at all costs.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Group projects

comment: Terrible; lectures are useless, drops additional project instructions a day before due date, grades by dartboard, ridiculously hard tests, and forced a 100% asynchronous online section to take synchronous tests and come in for project demos.  If I could rate lower than a 1, I would.  DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR.  He will teach you next to nothing.

Terrible; he forced students to take synchronous tests and come in for project demos for an asynchronous 100% online section. Grades by dartboard, gives additional project instructions at the last minute, and refuses to take real life into consideration.  

If I could rate lower than 1, I would. DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR.  Period.

Project is alright but tests are impossible and have to be taken at the same time as the in-person class. Unclear grading criteria followed by harsh grading. Online class is an afterthought. Reporting him doesn't do anything as he is pretty high up in the CS department ladder so no one can touch him. The worst professor so far.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: If you have a choice, take another professor for parallel and distributed computing. The project instructions are vague and the tests are difficult. The average was routinely in the 60s. He does not curve and half the class dropped by the first exam.

Taking Bobbie's class online and he treats his online students as an afterthought compared to his in-class students. His online class is the most disorganized class I have seen at KSU. This class is supposed to be Asynchronous but he forces students to watch lectures and take exams during his in-person class. Projects unclear and grades harsh.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: The grade comes from 3 tests, 2 papers and 2 group project papers. He can take a while to get an email responses from him. The tests are on the hard side. If you do not go to class or re-watch the lectures, you will be lost.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--So many papers

comment: This professor is a good teacher and you will learn a lot in his class but the lectures are kinda heavy. Go to his classes because he needs to know your name to get a good grade in exams and projects!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: I took Bobbie's class online and I constantly felt like online students were an afterthought for him and I feel like he could've done better managing his online class. His lectures are long and straight from the textbook, so it was easy enough to study right before his tests. The group project was very vague and the instructions should be updated.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: For some reason, he treats the online class exactly the same as the in-person class. This means you are required to take exams and watch lectures during the same exact time period as the in-person class. Very inconvenient if you have other classes scheduled within a similar time period.

The projects are quite challenging but fun. His tests are basically impossible and are most of the grade. If you take this course you must read far ahead and take extremely detailed notes to get a C. He put questions on the exam from sections he told us were not on the exam.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Group projects

comment: Dr. Bobbie is very kind and knowledgeable about the subject. His tests require short answers, and so take a lot of knowledge, but they are not unfair. I recommend actually reading the textbook and making flashcards, which makes this class a good amount of work. I'd say slightly harder than average, but not awful. I would take him again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: Very difficult and a super hard grader but he does care and will usually curve at the end to make sure people don't do too bad.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: He's not a bad teacher, not as bad as people make him out to be. He is tough though. But this class isn't impossible, you just really need to put the hours in. This isnt one of those "easy" barely any work types, you can invest to succeed, and you will learn. Goodluck for those who do take him! Don't give up.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: The only grades are homework (10%), group project (25%), and the remaining is tests. Read the textbook for the class as much as you can. Lectures are a bit incoherent but follow them too. If you are online be ready to have an hour to do the test at his determined time. The primary thing I hate about his class is how subjective everything is.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: He has good lectures. The project is difficult and very poorly specified. His class relies heavily on the textbook and lectures so be prepared to take extremely extensive notes and be able to cross-reference them with the text. Don't expect any preparation for exams in the homework or quizzes, all you get is a list of textbook sections to study.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Lectures aren't particularly helpful, be prepared to read the textbook in class instead. Tests are ridiculously matriculates, so make sure you know the material in every cardinal direction. Never be late, even for a split second. I was one minute late in submitting my final (when corona hit) and will most likely fail even though i have good grades.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: He gives work that would require years of experience and an extensive knowledge. He also doesn't seem to understand operating system concepts! He hangs on to slides like a kid does with floats in a pool and then is unable to answer questions! Really!?! To some he seems to know his stuff but he comes off as a complete hack! Avoid at all costs!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: He is unreasonable with his project scope, unclear with test and assignment instructions, and lacks the communication skills that many motivated students rely on. The professor is apathetic when grading and replying to student concerns. I would definitely recommend you take another professor no matter if you're taking CS3502 online or offline.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Absolutely hate his teaching. Project is not clear, lecture is lack of professionalism and obtuse grading in a graduate course. No insight into his horrible teaching methods.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: It is well know in the campus that this professor only pass the students that make a friendship with him. so that, you have to go many times to his offices and pretend to being interesting in the course, but more important be friend with him. more the 75% of students withdraw the course. Tests are impossible. but you pass with friendship.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: I have not idea how this professor is tolerated by KSU, He does not meet the standards of the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Commission on Colleges. It is obvious, he never designed an OS in real world, he deliver blurry instructions on the project and his lectures and videos are a disaster. Just avoid take him.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Just avoid problems and keep away of this professor. His lectures are poor designed, he writes on power point presentations like a child in kinder, He does not provide detailed info about the project. Unless, you can read his mind and write exact what he is thinking , you can go for taking the tests. Go get other Professor for learn something.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: If you take him online, its the same as taking him in class: he expects you to be present online at face to face class time. Gives 0 feedback. If you have an issue with the group project, his response is something about fairness, figure it out yourself. Very tough grader. 3 credit hour class, demanded far more than 3 credits worth of work.
rating_tags: Group projects--Tough grader

comment: The subject is difficult and there's a massive group project worth a big portion of your grade, so pick good team members. I got screwed over by mine, but Bobbie took that into account in the grade. I still wouldn't repeat the experience though, this was by far the most stressful class of my life. If you have problems, speak to Dr. Bobbie EARLY.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Group projects

comment: His group project was the hardest part of the class. We had to make a virtual OS, and for some reason, he decided to group up physical lecture students with online students, making scheduling harder for us. The project specifications were also too vague and hard to understand, and he scolded us on presentations as if they were obvious.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: His online class required students to take exams at the same time as his in-class students. Tests are lengthy and all short answer. Final project is designing and presenting your own Operating System. Over half the class dropped before the withdrawal date. Passing his class seems doable but he really makes you work for your grade. Avoid if possible
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Bobbie knows his stuff. But he expects you to know it too. His semester project combined with his detailed tests make this class seem like 2, and sometimes more. Get ready to read, study, and work until you can't anymore.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Beware if taking online! I took his online course as my job prevented me from taking in in class portion. I came to find out that he treats his online class as his in class portion. All tests are required to take at the same time as the inclass portion, and lectures are livestreamed(using a poor quality microphone) during that time as well.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Took him for OS, Algorithms, and Distributed. His classes really are easier than advertised. His tests require critical thinking rather than memorization, so required study time is low. The code for the group project was easy enough for me to do solo. If you read the book and know how to code, then you can easily pass his classes.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Dr. Bobbie is MY FAVORITE PROFESSOR! Why? When you take Dr. Bobbie, you come out of his class with a sense of accomplishment and pride. Dr. Bobbie is no slouch when it comes to hard work, and this is the very definition of real academia; hard work! Any student earning a D in Dr. Bobbie's class easily outperforms a student whom was spoonfed an A
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Amazing lectures

comment: I have taken Patrick Bobbie twice! Once for Operating Systems and another for Distributed Computing. Although his tests are difficult, he really tries to make you learn conceptually everything you do. His projects are hard and very difficult. But given time, you can make a passing grade which he will help by curving for you.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Took him online. He is knowledgeable but recorded lectures are too long and poor quality. Not specific with what he wants & gives no feedback on tests. Indecisive on when & what times the tests are, and is barely willing to compromise with students.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read

comment: If you're a person who loves to challenge yourself and you perform well under pressure, then Bobbie is the professor for you. His class is like a crucible, if you survive, you'll exit better at the trade than when you entered. Be prepared to work hard and READ THE BOOK. Only 3 tests and a project so you can't afford to slack off at any point.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Lectures are average. I recommend reading the book instead. The tests are unnecessarily difficult. He grades tough too. The project is poorly explained, but it's 30% of your class grade and graded very seriously. You can probably get a B if you spend about 4x more time for this class than you would another class. You will not enjoy it.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: Please, just dont do it. Its not worth the stress. He makes you think in way that just arent necessary. Theres 4 total grades and no extra credit. The average grade on test 1 was an F, not a D.... an F.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: He tried to get people in his online class to come take a test on campus besides the fact that he is an extremely hard professor.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Try as hard as you can to avoid this teacher.  He is a really nice person, but his tests are probably the hardest tests you will have to take.  The group project is also a challenge, so if you do take this class, make sure your group members know what they are doing.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Unlike most other CS classes up to this point, you will need to commit yourself to reading the material or you will struggle. The assignments are intimidating at first, but the workload is not bad. Go through the review exercises in the book and getting an A is not hard. Lectures will be more helpful after reading the book prior to class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Professor Bobbie is literally the worst professor at KSU. I took him online and you couldn't even understand his lectures because of poor audio quality. He did not fix the issue and we spent half a semester with no lecture recordings. It's as if there was no professor to guide us. Only two tests, fail one and you won't pass. Fail rate is VERY HIGH!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He really cares about helping his students learn the material. He's earned the nickname "Soul Slayer," but I am not sure why. His tests are tough, but if you read the book, you should do well. The group project is cumbersome, so start early and stay on top of it and get good partners to work with. I really enjoyed his class!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: A good guy... not so much a good professor.  The group project is the worst, the lectures are good if you can actually hear and understand them, he's mode of test are horrible, he takes weeks to reply to emails and acts like you are a bother if you try to attend his office hours.  Please take someone else!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: This guy might be the worst professor I have ever taken. Mumbles through the powerpoint slides, never clarified the group project. Tests were brutal, and his grading was worse. The feedback you received were just a bunch of question marks. Half the course dropped after the first exam. Take someone else if you can
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Class is very hard, tests are very hard, and the semester project will make you reconsider your major, if you have a choice don't take him, his class will make your GPA sink like the Titanic
Makes you work for your grade, but in the end you will master the material. Really helped after landing my first job with Delta. Not an easy class but will be worth it when you get to the industry.

Took him for Distributed Computing. His tests are very hard. Make sure you study and read the book. No required attendance but it definitely helps. He's pretty boring during lecture but the material is all there. You just have to work for it. Course project was hard but it's a group project so make sure your group does their part.

If I recall correctly this was his first year teaching CS 1301. If you want to pass this class, you're going to want to rely more on the book. His lectures are long and often use examples that contain stuff you probably won't know. Expect random quizzes over stuff you just learned and not get to do any work in class. Test are completely written.

Bobbie is very hard to understand due to his lack of pronunciation, accent, low voice and what is the worst part is he SCRIBBLES all over the Powerpoints with the mouse... Epic Fail here!! I even wrote out every term in the chapters and read the chapters twice but still made a 55 on the tests. The questions hardly had anything to do with the book.

Had him for both CS4253 (distributed computing) and CS 3243(operating systems) If you have an option take anyone else you can. If you are stuck with taking him, don't worry about grades on tests because he usually curves them about 40 points. What really determines your grade is how well written your report on the project is.

Patrick 'The Soulslayer' Bobbie... It's like playing Demon's Souls on NG+++ with a new character. Hardest class in the curriculum BY FAR. His tests rank how hard he destroyed you, and the project will make you kill yourself. But, if you survive, you will be considered a master programmer and computer scientist, probably the next Bill Gates. GL HF.
HE IS THE BEST I HAVE EVER KNOWN
His class is so hard to learn something.

Dr. Bobbie knows the material well but is not good at teaching the subject. His exams are ambiguous. He never provided students with grades on the projects. He required 16 pages of documents for the projects. He focuses more on documents than material pertinent to the course.

Focus on the project.  He gives a rubric for the report, give him everything he asks for.  The project determines your grade and the report is what's most important since it shows what you know.  Make sure you collect the data results he requests, too.   For his tests, find the solutions to the book exercises on the net and read the slides.
Very knowledgeable professor, great to go to for help in his or other classes, and always willing to work with you on times and other classes.
Great guy. Teaches well, and is very fair. Great attitude, and obviously a philanthropist. Much respect for the man.

Lays everything up front. His test are basically essay questions, but the majority of your grade is based on the final project. Don't sweat the test and work your butt off on the project if you want an A
No Comments

Prof Bobbie is a great guy. I believe he started computing with the great pioneers. Just don't wait until the last minute to start his projects, they are a little demanding. Bottom line if you go to class and talk to him from time to time(and are competent) you will get an A.
